metadata.name: ai-foundry
metadata.description: Creates an AI Foundry account and project with Standard Agent Services.
Optional. Specify the name of cognitive service account deployment.
Required. The name of Cognitive Services account deployment model.
Required. The format of Cognitive Services account deployment model.
Required. The version of Cognitive Services account deployment model.
Required. Properties of Cognitive Services account deployment model.
Required. The name of the resource model definition representing SKU.
Optional. The capacity of the resource model definition representing SKU.
Optional. The tier of the resource model definition representing SKU.
Optional. The size of the resource model definition representing SKU.
Optional. The family of the resource model definition representing SKU.
Optional. The resource model definition representing SKU.
Optional. The name of RAI policy.
Optional. The version upgrade option.
The type for a cognitive services account deployment.
Required. Name of the database .

Optional. Request units per second. Will be ignored if `autoscaleSettingsMaxThroughput` is used. Setting throughput at the database level is only recommended for development/test or when workload across all containers in the shared throughput database is uniform. For best performance for large production workloads, it is recommended to set dedicated throughput (autoscale or manual) at the container level and not at the database level. Defaults to 400.

Optional. Specifies the autoscale settings and represents maximum throughput the resource can scale up to. The autoscale throughput should have valid throughput values between 1000 and 1000000 inclusive in increments of 1000. If the value is not set, then autoscale will be disabled. Setting throughput at the database level is only recommended for development/test or when workload across all containers in the shared throughput database is uniform. For best performance for large production workloads, it is recommended to set dedicated throughput (autoscale or manual) at the container level and not at the database level.
Required. Name of the container.
Required. List of paths using which data within the container can be partitioned. For kind=MultiHash it can be up to 3. For anything else it needs to be exactly 1.

Optional. Default to 0. Indicates how long data should be retained in the analytical store, for a container. Analytical store is enabled when ATTL is set with a value other than 0. If the value is set to -1, the analytical store retains all historical data, irrespective of the retention of the data in the transactional store.

Optional. Specifies the Autoscale settings and represents maximum throughput, the resource can scale up to. The autoscale throughput should have valid throughput values between 1000 and 1000000 inclusive in increments of 1000. If value is set to null, then autoscale will be disabled. For best performance for large production workloads, it is recommended to set dedicated throughput (autoscale or manual) at the container level.
Conditional. The conflict resolution path in the case of LastWriterWins mode. Required if `mode` is set to 'LastWriterWins'.
Conditional. The procedure to resolve conflicts in the case of custom mode. Required if `mode` is set to 'Custom'.
Required. Indicates the conflict resolution mode.
Optional. The conflict resolution policy for the container. Conflicts and conflict resolution policies are applicable if the Azure Cosmos DB account is configured with multiple write regions.

Optional. Default to -1. Default time to live (in seconds). With Time to Live or TTL, Azure Cosmos DB provides the ability to delete items automatically from a container after a certain time period. If the value is set to "-1", it is equal to infinity, and items don't expire by default.
Optional. Indexing policy of the container.
Optional. Default to Hash. Indicates the kind of algorithm used for partitioning.
Optional. Default to 1 for Hash and 2 for MultiHash - 1 is not allowed for MultiHash. Version of the partition key definition.
Optional. Default to 400. Request Units per second. Will be ignored if autoscaleSettingsMaxThroughput is used.
Required. List of paths must be unique for each document in the Azure Cosmos DB service.
Optional. The unique key policy configuration containing a list of unique keys that enforces uniqueness constraint on documents in the collection in the Azure Cosmos DB service.
Optional. Set of containers to deploy in the database.
The type for an Azure Cosmos DB for NoSQL database.
Required. Name of the resource to create.
Optional. Name of the AI Foundry project.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Specifies the OpenAI deployments to create.
Optional. List of Cosmos DB databases to create.
Optional. Specifies the size of the jump-box Virtual Machine.

Optional. Specifies the name of the administrator account for the jump-box virtual machine. Defaults to "[name]vmuser". This is necessary to provide secure access to the private VNET via a jump-box VM with Bastion.

Optional. Specifies the password for the jump-box virtual machine. This is only required when aiFoundryType is StandardPrivate (when VM is deployed). Value should meet 3 of the following: uppercase character, lowercase character, numeric digit, special character, and NO control characters.
Optional. Specifies the resource tags for all the resources. Tag "azd-env-name" is automatically added to all resources.
Optional. Specifies the object id of a Microsoft Entra ID user. In general, this the object id of the system administrator who deploys the Azure resources. This defaults to the deploying user.
Optional. IP address to allow access to the jump-box VM. This is necessary to provide secure access to the private VNET via a jump-box VM with Bastion. If not specified, all IP addresses are allowed.
Optional. Resource ID of an existing Log Analytics workspace for VM monitoring. If provided, data collection rules will be created for the VM.
Optional. Enable VM monitoring with data collection rules. Only effective if logAnalyticsWorkspaceResourceId is provided.
Required. Specifies the AI Foundry deployment type. Allowed values are Basic, StandardPublic, and StandardPrivate.
Required. Whether to include Azure AI Content Safety in the deployment.
Optional. A collection of rules governing the accessibility from specific network locations.
Specifies the name of the virtual network.
Specifies the address prefixes of the virtual network.
Specifies the name of the subnet which contains the virtual machine.
Specifies the address prefix of the subnet which contains the virtual machine.
Specifies the name of the network security group associated to the subnet hosting the virtual machine.
Specifies the name of the subnet which contains the Foundry agent.
Specifies the address prefix of the subnet which contains the Foundry agent.
Specifies the name of the network security group associated to the subnet hosting the Foundry agent.
Specifies the Bastion subnet IP prefix. This prefix must be within vnet IP prefix address space.
Specifies the name of the network security group associated to the subnet hosting Azure Bastion.
Specifies whether Azure Bastion should be created.
Specifies the name of the Azure Bastion resource.
Enable/Disable Copy/Paste feature of the Bastion Host resource.
Enable/Disable File Copy feature of the Bastion Host resource.
Enable/Disable IP Connect feature of the Bastion Host resource.
Enable/Disable Shareable Link of the Bastion Host resource.
Enable/Disable Tunneling feature of the Bastion Host resource.
Specifies the name of the Azure Public IP Address used by the Azure Bastion Host.
Specifies the name of the Azure Bastion Host SKU.
Specifies the name of the Azure NAT Gateway.
Specifies a list of availability zones denoting the zone in which Nat Gateway should be deployed.
Specifies the number of Public IPs to create for the Azure NAT Gateway.
Specifies the idle timeout in minutes for the Azure NAT Gateway.
Optional IP address to allow access throught Bastion NSG. If not specified, all IP addresses are allowed.
Specifies the location.
Specifies the resource tags.
Name of the Key Vault.
Specifies the location for all the Azure resources.
Optional. Tags to be applied to the resources.
Resource ID of the virtual network to link the private DNS zones.
Resource ID of the subnet for the private endpoint.
Specifies whether network isolation is enabled. This will create a private endpoint for the Key Vault and link the private DNS zone.
Specifies the object id of a Microsoft Entra ID user. In general, this the object id of the system administrator who deploys the Azure resources. This defaults to the deploying user.
Resource ID of the Log Analytics workspace for diagnostic logs.
Specifies the AI Foundry deployment type. Allowed values are Basic, StandardPublic, and StandardPrivate.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

Conditional. The name of the parent Database Account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the SQL database .
Optional. Array of containers to deploy in the SQL database.

Optional. Request units per second. Will be ignored if autoscaleSettingsMaxThroughput is used. Setting throughput at the database level is only recommended for development/test or when workload across all containers in the shared throughput database is uniform. For best performance for large production workloads, it is recommended to set dedicated throughput (autoscale or manual) at the container level and not at the database level.

Optional. Specifies the Autoscale settings and represents maximum throughput, the resource can scale up to. The autoscale throughput should have valid throughput values between 1000 and 1000000 inclusive in increments of 1000. If value is set to null, then autoscale will be disabled. Setting throughput at the database level is only recommended for development/test or when workload across all containers in the shared throughput database is uniform. For best performance for large production workloads, it is recommended to set dedicated throughput (autoscale or manual) at the container level and not at the database level.
Optional. Tags of the SQL database resource.
